paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Bilateral breast cancer at ages 66 and 74, ovarian cancer at age 77

individual_records.phenotype_details: Bilateral breast cancer and ovarian cancer
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Variant c.8488-1G > A was detected in a patient who developed bilateral breast cancer at age 66 and 74 and ovarian cancer at age 77.

functional_data.summary: The variant affects the essential nucleotide -1 (G to A) of the acceptor splice site of BRCA2 exon 20, leading to aberrant splicing.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in a consanguineous Fanconi anemia patient.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was previously unreported in the BIC mutation database.
key_quotes: This variant had not been reported at the BIC mutation database although it had formerly been found in a consanguineous Fanconi anemia patient.
Altogether these data strongly support the pathogenicity of c.8488-1G > A.

patients.phenotype: Not specified, but associated with breast/ovarian cancer

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Lymphocyte RT-PCR of one carrier patient and we found the wt allele and the corresponding 5-nucleotide deletion transcript derived from the genomic variant (c.9026_9030del) without any splicing anomaly.

functional_data.summary: The variant is a deleterious frameshift mutation that would lead to a premature stop codon.

variants.population_frequency: 7.6% of BRCA2 families in Castilla y León (Spain)
variants.additional_notes: It is one of the most prevalent mutations in the Spanish population.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.9026_9030del of exon 23 is a deleterious frameshift mutation that would lead to a premature stop codon.
It is one of the most prevalent mutations in the Spanish population, accounting for 7.6% of BRCA2 families in Castilla y León (Spain).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
